content.description: On the backside of the Breadloaf, stand start in two obvious sloper pocket/cracks. Make sure your hands are in the right orientation to make a big slap move up high and right to a good sloper edge. Your feet are very bad, it is best to swear your left foot and cross your hands at the start. Once you catch the slanted sloper edge, reach out left to another sloper pocket, get your feet up, and slap a sloper on the top.
content.location: On the backside of the Breadloaf boulder, most of it is slabby looking. It starts in two obvious pocket/sloper features that are quite small.

content.description: Sit start to the left of Un Pain Aux Lardons and Font on the left-hand arete. Climb straight up to a slopey top out.
content.location: Located on the backside of the Breadloaf boulder to the left of Font.

content.description: Stand start on the right-hand arete of the Breadloaf (closest to the woods) with your left hand on a crimp and your right hand on an undercling down low. Throw a toe hook on the arete and reach your right hand up to a quartz sidepull. Move left into bad slopers and traverse the boulder all the way to Loaf And Jug. Top out on Loaf And Jug.
content.location: Stand starts on the right-hand arete of the main face of the Breadloaf and traverses left into Loaf And Jug.

content.description: Stand start to the right of Un Pain Aux Lardons and Font and climb straight up to one of the sloper slots used on Un Pain Aux Lardons. Finish as for Un Pain Aux Lardons.
content.location: Located to the right of Un Pain Aux Lardons and Font on the backside of the Breadloaf.

content.description: Stand start on two good edges that are used halfway up Loaf And Jug. From there, get high feet and dyno straight up to a sharp-looking top edge. If you hit the right spot, there is a small dish that you will catch.
content.location: Stand start on two good edges used on Loaf And Jug and dyno to the top lip.

content.description: Sit start on the left-hand arete of the Breadloaf and work up the arete using crimps and slopers to top out.
content.location: Sit starts on the far left-hand side of the Breadloaf (closest to the United States of Banana boulder)

content.description: Stand start on the left-hand arete of the Breadloaf and work up the arete to the top.
content.location: Stand start for McNutty sit on the left-hand arete.

content.description: Sit start in the same crack pocket as Follow The Baguette. Instead of going up and right, go up to the good edge, and then work up and left using good edges and jugs to top out.
content.location: Starts the same way as Follow The Baguette in the center of the main face of the Miche de Pain.

content.description: Sit start on the arete facing the woods. Work straight up to the top veering left to top out the more difficult way.
content.location: Sit starts on the arete closest to the woods.

content.description: Stand start to the left of McNutty and the left-hand arete of the main face on the slab. Climb straight up the slab to the top.
content.location: Stand starts to the left of McNutty on the slab around the left-hand arete of the main face.

content.description: Sit start low on the right-hand side of the main face to the immediate left of the right arete on two hairline crimps. Get a good heel hook on a low shelf and pressure up off of the crimps to another right-hand crimp high up. Slap up and left to the sloper "baguette" rail, match, and finish as for Dr. Guillotine.
content.location: Sit starts on bad crimps on the right-hand side of the main face.

content.description: Sit start as for McNutty Sit on the left-hand arete of the main face. Climb up to the stand start for McNutty and traverse right and up into the top portion of Loaf And Jug.
content.location: Sit starts as for McNutty Sit on the left-hand arete of the main face of the Breadloaf boulder. Climbs up to the stand and then traverses right into Loaf And Jug.

content.description: Stand start to the right of Slab Master Face Killer on an easy slab face. Climb straight up to a mellow slab top out.
content.location: Stand starts to the right of Slab Master Face Killer on the backside of the Breadloaf boulder.

content.description: Stand start as for Un Pain Aux Lardons and climb straight up on slopers to a slopey top out.
content.location: Located to the right of Snake Charmer and starts as for Un Pain Aux Lardons on the back side of the Breadloaf boulder.

content.description: Sit start down low in the middle of the tallest, most vertical face on the Breadloaf in a crack jug. Make a big move up to a decent edge, and then traverse right along the "baguette" rail. Off of that, find bad sloper-crimps with high feet to reach a sloper at the top. After that, mantle. Tops out far-right on the vertical face (closest to the woods).
content.location: Sit starts in the center of the vertical face along the worn pathway then traverses right.

content.description: Stand start on the sloper edge that you traverse onto when climbing Follow The Baguette from the sit start with a high right foot. The start is almost directly below the top out. Pressure up into a sloper crimp and then slap for the top. The original way is to dyno from the start to the lip.
content.location: On the right-hand side of the main face of the Breadloaf, in between The Heel and Follow The Baguette.

content.description: Stand starts to the left of Dr. Guillotine on the sloper rail and goes straight up utilizing extremely thin crimps.
content.location: Stand starts to the left of Dr. Guillotine on the sloper rail and goes straight up.

content.description: A beautiful, decent-sized boulder just as you enter the powerline on the right. This block has a host of problems ranging in grades. The climbing is dynamic, slopey, and very fun.
